title: Outstanding food
text: Ordered a meal for family of three. The meat was all tender, beautifully cooked and extremely tasty. Fresh salad, humus olives loads of nan style bread. Sauces & dips.

title: Nice people. Traditional food
text: The owner and his wife are lovely. The service was a little bit poor. They completely forgot one meal but brought hot fresh cheese pies (which were delicious) to apologise. The food was hot, Greek and basic. The prices were great.

title: Excellent food
text:
Excellent food beautiful lamb and potatoes in lemon sauce. Mussel saganaki was delicious.
Lamb chops were the best I’ve had in ages

title: Excellent
text:
This hotel is on the edge if the city. Easy access by metro. The decor and service is top quality and the restaurant food is amazingly delicious with generous portions. Staff are friendly and helpful. The pool is small but adequate. My only complaint is the steps into / out of the pool are small. They need an extra step at the bottom and top as it is difficult if you are not aged 30 or do not have long legs.
Overall we loved it

title: Amazing
text: Great experience. Take water with you. Wear good shoes as some of the marble is very slippery. Take your time and go to the top it is well worth it. Queues for tickets not too bad. Lovely cafes around the base.

title: A bit of Greece outside Greece
text: Beautiful food. Delicious starters, excellent service, generous portions. Beautiful lamb chops. Will definitely return

title: Excellent authentic Egyptian food
text: Excellent authentic Egyptian food. Served by lovely friendly people Alaa and his team were amazing. Can recommend the mixed grill and the veal chops. But everything was lovely.

title: Xmas treat with friends
text: Busy busy time of year. Managed to get a table. Fair menu - 2 or 3 courses. The beef was amazingly tasty !!disappointed in the Xmas pudding. Bit tasteless tiny portion and equally tiny portion of custard was lumpy !! 10% added service charge. Would prefer to leave own tip

title: Pre panto
text: We have eaten here pre panto ladies lunch for the last 5 years. It is always the Christmas menu in December. The food is always well cooked and the service good (we do pre order food) however all 18 of us were disappointed in the Xmas menu choices - nearly all ended up with the daily special of fish & chips or burger. We have had my her nicer choices in the past. Also we asked if we could order pie from the normal menu but was told no. Only to discover pie had been added when we arrived on the day. We HAVE booked for next year but come on CC pull your finger out with Xmas choices please

title: Amazing food
text: We visited on recommendation the atmosphere was good. Great menu. Great service fantastic tasty food. Served with 2 sauces one of which we purchased a bottle to bring away. Wished we had visited here the night before as well

title: Disappointed
text:
We tried this restaurant following a recommendation but we were disappointed. The noise levels were very high possibly due to the high ceilings. The menu seemed comprehensive but the quality was not so good. Mussels in garlic sauce - the garlic was chunky hard and raw. Not a pleasant taste. The salad was a huge bowl of lettuce mainly. The order was prepared wrong so the salad came before the grilled chicken breast. Then the breast was coated in something. Steaks were not the nicest we have had in South Africa. They had run out of draught beer.
Disappointing

title: Excellent
text: This property is absolutely beautiful. Amazing views. Friendly hosts. Nothing is too much trouble. Exceptional attention to detail. Close to Darling and Buffelsfontein game drive. A few restaurants in the town lulas and kaiiaki are superb. Would thoroughly recommend

title: Brilliant
text:
From the minute we crossed the entrance we were amazed. Delayed by a family of baboons we got lots of pics. Slow drive down to the point where we spotted an ostrich. Bit too far in the distance to photograph. The funicular ride to the lighthouse was amazing and we explored from all angles. Got lots of photos of the point and peninsula. Amazing coves and beaches below.
Great value for money. Plenty of toilet opportunities. Well stocked shops
Would definitely recommend. We had a much better ostrich shot on the way back. Spent a good couple of hours there. Arrived early it was empty but very quickly filled with coach tours and mini busses
Very enjoyable

title: Amazing place
text: Everything you could wish for under one roof. Outdoor seating available. We tried the bar. Excellent cherry cider/lager. 2 floors of food drink and choices. The champagne and seafood looked amazing. We tried desserts from the donut stall. Vegetarian options readily available in the food sections. The smell was as delicious as the food

title: Beautiful !
text: Having eaten breakfast here with complements of the Quayside Hotel. We decided to try our evening meal. We were not disappointed. Excellent service, specials board including fish of the day. Wednesdays is burger night 2 for the price of 1. Bargain. Excellently cooked and presented. Great prices will definitely visit again

title: Hidden gem
text: Whilst driving around looking for a place to have ‘tea & cake’ we came by chance across this little gem. The choices of drinks and cakes were amazing for this little hidden tea room - we only had tea & cakes but the meals sounded amazing too. Little craft shop. Friendly efficient staff. Great play area for kids outside. Don’t drive past ! - you won’t be disappointed.

title: Beautiful hidden cove
text: We came across this little beach looking for a tea stop. The sand is white and soft. The sea a beautiful blue. Popular with surfers as the waves were quite choppy. Plenty of parking but nothing much else

title: Great place
text: We spent a couple of hours here and thoroughly enjoyed it. We could have returned throughout the day but went in late afternoon. Lots of interesting exhibits. Things to do. Plenty for kids. Great entertainment

title: Not to be missed
text:
We have ridden hop on hop off buses in many countries. We had a 2 day ticket and saw loads of the city, beaches, main attractions.
Great value.

title: Excellent place
text: This area reminded us of San Francisco. Quite cosmopolitan. Busy, many shops of all descriptions. Bustling, entertainment, great views, lovely people. Many bars & restaurant to choose from. Can’t fault any if them.

title: Exciting
text:
We travelled the cable car with a ‘tablecloth’ on the mountain. Hoping the midday sun would ‘burn’ it off.
It was amazing travelling up through the clouds to the summit disappearing into the haze.
The floor rotated so a great view all round. Felt very safe and secure.

title: Excellent location
text:
We have just stayed here for 3 nights. Paid extra for waterfront marina view. We were not disappointed with the apartment it was huge 2 bedrooms both with en-suite large longe and fully equipped kitchen.
When we arrived the main TV would not work and the agent couldn’t fix it.
The housekeeping came as promised on the Monday but only did one bedroom and bathroom so bit disappointing otherwise would have scored 5
Safe underground parking with lift access to our door. Security 24/7 on the entrance to the complex
The location is excellent and we have spent all our time in the V& A waterfront. The food is amazing at fantastic prices.
Beware of world travel plugs. We were left with no chargers until the last night when the agent came to our help as the plugs are big thick round pins. Nothing like we had on our ‘world travel plug’

title: Delightful food
text: We enjoyed our visit with newly found friends the menu gave a lovely history. The food was absolutely delicious and the service friendly and efficient. Very busy but we had booked a table.

title: Beautiful food
text: We sat upstairs on a windy evening but it was still special the cheese platter starter was very pretty and the chicken fillet was delicious. Efficient friendly waiters but we just could not manage dessert

title: Good find
text: Parked up and found this gorgeous restaurant. Excellent service. Beautiful food. Had a swim not 20m from our table back for dessert and coffee. No pressure very relaxed visit

title: Super taverna
text: This taverna was next door to our hotel so we popped in for lunch one day. Average prices. Cold beer excellent food friendly service. We had Greek salad and zucchini balls but the other dishes looked and sounded delicious. I’m sure we will rerun to sample the rest one evening

title: Perfect location
text: This restaurant is right in the heart of the sea front. Has a dining menu and a comprehensive drinks menu. Perfect spot for watching the sunset behind the mountain. That said expect to pay higher prices for the location. Cocktails €13-€15 each

title: A hidden gem
text: Extremely popular little restaurant all the tables are outside in the small alleyways. We queued for a table and people continued to queue after us. Excellent meze, delicious food, friendly not rushed no pressure service despite people waiting for tables. Excellent value for money. We (2 of us) had bread, olives, olive oil, Greek salad, mushroom pie, meat balls, zucchini balls and chicken fricasee with water and house red wine. Total of €37 perfect. Complimentary cakes at the end - will definitely visit again before we go home

title: Beautiful
text:
Very attentive staff. Delicious food. Starter was lovely,
Fish filleted at the table. Delicious pasta. Complementary dessert. Tables booked up so unless you go early you may be turned away if you don’t book

title: Lovely food
text: Lovely people lovely food. Cold beer what more can you ask. Very obliging. Nothing too much trouble. Food traditional

title: Amazing hotel
text:
We purposely visited this hotel to indulge in a ABBA weekend. We could not have chosen better. The hotel is the museum and is amazing. The service on arrival was efficient and friendly. The hotel room was spotless and the beds extremely comfortable. The food was fresh and delicious. We had easy access to the teams and boats on our door step and had. Poked ticket for the mamma Mia party night which was at the side of our hotel. We had the perfect weekend and adored Stockholm. It would have been nice to go in the Tivoli fun fair but a bit of season. Maybe next time.
Definitely worthy of a visit and be sure to do the museum & party !!

title: Great place
text: Lovely place to walk. Places to eat and drink. Served by tram number 7. Would imagine it is very different in all seasons x

title: Travelled from UK
text: We came here just to try this experience and we were not disappointed. Great food. Fantastic atmosphere. Found was perfect. Fab floor shows and excellent ABBA music. We were not disappointed

title: Amazing building
text: Great place to visit. Guards change around lunch time daily. Don’t miss it building is beautiful. Lively places around the palace

title: Great experience
text: So glad we did this. -5 degrees. Great experience. Great drinks in frozen glasses would definitely do it again !

title: Amazing experience
text: Travelled all the way from UK for the experience and was not disappointed !Very informative, plenty to do, interactive areas. AND lots of ABBA music. Just perfect

title: Perfect spot
text: Great staff. Fab atmosphere. Introduced us to an alternative to tonic. Food excellent. Huge portions. Well cooked great service

title: Lovely food spot
text: Having a catch up with a friend we started with coffee and progressed to a lovely lunch. Desserts were amazing and difficult to choose from such choice. Warm and friendly. Reasonable prices for a garden centre. Quick service. Nice garden centre will definitely return

title: Winter retreat
text:
For our first ever winter holiday this was fabulous. Nothing outside the hotels to really see or do but plenty in the hotel. 5 min transfer time from the airport. You can see the hotel from airport car park
All inclusive buffets were amazing with food to suit ever taste and need. 3 speciality restaurants which you have to book well in advance. - do it as soon as you arrive !
Areas around the hotel are well kept and clean but some areas a little ‘tired’ and in need of a bit of TLC. Probably due to the hotel being an all year round resort. People were friendly. Service excellent. We had a couple of minor room issues while we were there but these were dealt with quickly and professionally.
Huge hotel - new one opened next door but I’m sure will be much more expensive.
Private clean beach. Lovely soft sand. Sea was pretty rough
A beach for breeding turtles when in season

title: Weekend break
text:
As a girly party of 5 we stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. Log burner (and radiators) 1 person slept in the sofa bed which was adequate
Slightly disappointed on arrival that we had to ask for logs , bedding and a towel heater in the main bathroom was not working.
Unsure what use the mezzanine was to anyone but we had a lovely weekend. We cooked our own breakfast. Well equipped kitchen and ate in the restaurant one night
Disappointed that the plunge pool and jacuzzi were out of action.
Easy ride into holmfirth. Steep walk up the hill either road or through vineyard and as it was winter there were no lights. We chose the road as the vineyard was rubble and uneven. This route was ok in daylight

title: Girls weekend
text:
We stayed the weekend for a girls weekend and booked afternoon tea and an evening meal. The food was lovely. Reasonable prices. Great service would definitely recommend and we will return
The views from the conservatory were stunning

title: Never fails on quality
text:
A old favourite which never fails to deliver on choice, originality and quality
The menu is different. The food excellent. I would say service is a little slower than it used to be and the music was a little bit too loud but never disappointing on the food
Glad we returned

title: Always delivers !
text:
We visited on spur of the moment. Busy time queue for tables but didn’t wait anywhere near as long as the suggested 20min wait.
Efficient service. hot delicious food. Value for money
Amazing olives and humous
Great tasty chicken

title: Hidden gem
text:
We visited on a friends recommendation and was not disappointed. i returned a few days later with a friend for a birthday treat. First visit we sat in the bar. For the birthday treat we sat in the restaurant - bar menu and Al a Carte are available in all areas.
Food was absolutely excellent and they have themed days throughout the week. We didnt book in the bar areas but did for the restaurant as reservations are advised at busy times some live music on friday nights

title: Fab pizzas
text: Having a quick turnaround on our boat trip to Stromboli we ate here sharing pizzas and Tropean salad service was great, pizza was excellent. They also have a cafe and pastry section on the street level. Only 1 toilet which caused some queues

title: Delightful place
text: We booked a boat trip from Tropea and went in search of an erupting volcano - we saw no activity but was an interesting place. The black sands are amazing

title: Great restaurant
text: While staying at the Oldwell hotel we ate in the restaurant on a few occasions and were not disappointed. Excellent food Gnocchi especially, great service and reasonable prices

title: Quality food
text: We passed this restaurant on a couple of occasions and when we called in we were pleasantly surprised. Excellent food great service

title: Excellent food
text: We drove here on 4 occasions during our 2 week stay, the food was average priced but excellent quality. Friendly staff who encouraged and embraced our 'sharing' of dishes. The Fileja with Nurja sausage was our favourite along with salmon penne and gnocchi

title: Excellent food
text: We visited Nico & Lily on recommendation by trip advisor and we were not disappointed. The choices were different the food was delicious. The service was perfect. Slightly pricier than run of the mill restaurants but food was a cut above the rest
place: Restaurant pinseria da Nico e Lilly

title: Very busy
text: We went on a weekend and although the beach was very nice parking was terrible. Preferred our local beach

title: Perfect venue
text:
We booked 2 weeks here with another couple and were very pleased with the location and setting. I think the staff are used to people passing through for a few nights but it was nice to get to know people on our longer stay.
The room were nice - one had a small patio / sitting area, our room didnt as they only had one available when we booked.
It was very clean and well serviced. The hotel provide 2 sun beds and an umbrella on the beach with your room number on
The beach is fine shingle and very clean.
Wifi was available in the main eating areas an on the beach directly in front of the hotel but in our rooms (13 & 1) the signal was very poor
Food was very good in both the cafe (limited menu) and the restaurant
Breakfast (included) was very comprehensive just let down by the fact the 'hot' breakfast items were far from warm let alone hot ! (Bacon, sausage, scrambled & fried eggs)
Lovely coffees and teas selection and local cheese & meats with gorgeous crusty bread.
Lots of fruit and cakes
There are a couple of pieces of fitness equipment on the paved area above the beach along with showers toilets & changing facilities.
You need a car as taxis are mega expensive and we didn't see any local transport
The rooms had a tv, air conditioning, a fridge and a safe
Our bathroom was nice but the shower was getting read for replacement.
The biggest let down for us was the mattress! Lumpy old and if you lost concentration you rolled to the middle - I would strongly suggest the owners try them out for themselves.Parking was good and everyone was friendly and helpful especially Adam the Polish waiter

title: Beautiful food
text: Popular restaurant in the square. Excellent food cooked beautifully. The lamb chops were the best I had all week (out of 3) the seafood pasta was delicious. Service was great view of the busy town square. Good for people watching

title: Traditional Greek food
text: This restaurant gives a Greek family feel with traditional dishes cooked to perfection. If the spicy stuffed peppers are in offer try them. They are delicious

title: Hidden gem
text: This restaurant is a street away from the main restaurants but is friendly. Has a fantastic menu and superb food. The service is excellent - can’t fault it

title: Perfect beach
text: We stayed in St. George’s bay and were not disappointed. The beach is long and clean but also shallow for a good way out. The sea is crystal clear and great for families. There are sun beds with umbrellas 10euro for 2 beds and a brolly. Plenty of places to eat and drink

title: Handy position
text:
Great little spot for M62 M606 etc pleasant staff. Clean and organised. Brewers fayre next door very obliging. Greggs and subway across the road. Handy and reasonably priced.
We only used the room during the day as we were dressing for a local wedding after travelling.

title: Indian wedding venue
text:
Our daughter and husband to be held their Indian wedding celebrations here. The service was great. Food fantastic. Decor and facilities beautiful.
The food was served hot and delicious very enjoyable

title: Great find
text:
We have lived 2 miles from here for years and never been in. Had a recommendation. Managed to get a last minute table and was not disappointed. The Gin choice was amazing ! Had its own menu. The staff were friendly attentive and helpful without being intrusive !
Menu choice was brilliant - the regular menu supplemented by a ‘specials’ and pies menu.
We all had a different starter and main and they were all delicious. The ham hock was huge and very tasty. The lamb shank fell off the bone. Chicken pie was one of the best I had ever had and the grey mullet was lovely.
Puddings were light and tasty - my only disappointment was the crumble could do with a bit more crumble (my personal taste) and either custard or 2 scoops of the sorbet. But that’s being nit picky. The sticky toffee pudding was light and yummy.
We forgot to take photos of the food - we usually do. But we will definitely returning so - next time !

title: Fab food
text:
We called in here for pre theatre tea time. There were quite a few Chinese / Asian customers dining. There is an early bird offer which you basically get a free starter.
The food was excellent. Tasty. Great value for money and the service was efficient & friendly.
Would definitely recommend

title: Excellent food
text:
We were treat to a meal here as compensation for a breakdown on the welsh highland railway
The hospitality was great. The food excellent and service brilliant.
Would definitely visit again if in the area

title: Experience not to forget
text:
We took a ride from Caernarfon to Porth Madog
As part of an organised National holidays trip. 20 of us boarded and enjoyed the experience, hospitality and scenery
20 min from the end we broke down - we were in the middle of nowhere and it took 3 hours to get us to the station
The staff were helpful and informative and made the experience one to remember
A big shout out to Rod Will & Alison

title: Extremely dated
text:
We stayed here with a coach trip / tour weekend
The hotel was busy.
The decor is tired and extremely dated some areas bordering on dilapidated.
There was a tv. Kettle in the room but the curtains were paper thin. Not very clean and the bathroom needed a complete overhaul.
The bedding was clean. Extra pillows were available. The doors all banged when you closed them so there is no way you could be quiet. The sofas in the lounges were filthy and everywhere needed a lick of paint. The food was basic the quiche would have been improved if it had been warmed and the lamb was thin and mass produced (processed)
The best meal was the buffet breakfast. This could have been slightly better had there been some beans as well as tomatoes and a chiller for the juice.
The pool was filthy and clearly needed a good clean so we didn’t venture.
There is a parrot in the reception and 2 behind reception that frankly were smelly and needed cleaning out.
Plenty of scope for improvement.
There was a ballroom downstairs with nightly entertainment but the bar on the ground floor was only open briefly at tea time meaning the guests who wanted to stay in the quieter lounges had to go to the noisy dark ballroom for drinks.
Some were returning guests but unfortunately we won’t be

title: Lovely walk
text:
The promenade was clean and spacious. Dog walkers joggers bikers
Views lovely across the bay and plenty to do in summer. Looked a bit bleak in October but lovely sea front

title: Unexpected visit
text: After our ferry was cancelled we were helped by Magdalena from the port. She took us to her hotel and set us up with a room for the night. Transport to & from port. Help to order food & beer. Breakfast basic but welcome

title: Just how we imagined
text: Our 2 day visit to Sydney Harbour was just as we expected. The lovely views of the bridge and opera house were stunning. Plenty of places to eat and drink. Great atmosphere. Easy access to all forms of transport

title: Beautiful building
text: This iconic building is so beautiful whichever angle you view it from. It is easily accessed and lively to visit. Tours inside are around every hour and well worth it.

title: Beautiful bridge
text:
A lovely part of sightseeing in Sydney. The iconic bridge is easily accessible and visible from all over Sydney.
You can walk up the structure if it takes your fancy or just cross it on ground level

title: Very cosmopolitan
text:
A beautiful Harbour buzzing with people, shopping mall, restaurants, bars, water taxis, boats and people
There is Madame Tussaud's and sea life if you are short of things to do but we just enjoyed watching the world go by as the sun set.
Not particularly cheap but most restaurants do lunch time offers and early bird meals from 5pm which are worth taking up

Amazing place

title: Amazing beach
text:
Not as big as I imagined but plenty to see and do. Restaurants in the beach. Surf wear shop. Public toilets and art work. There is a skater park and lovely sitting areas
The beach is lovely sand and the waves are amazing. Great people watching either surfers or visitors.
On the road above the beach are hotels restaurants and souvenir shops. Easy to get to from Sydney

title: Amazing
text:
So glad we took the opportunity to stay here as part of our trip. We were on 47th floor. Amazing views of the sea and gardens by the bay
The roof top pool is amazing and you have to swim in the day and at night to appreciate the different atmosphere. The beds in the water are tricky when trying to keep your possessions dry. There is an adult only section of the pool.
Cocktails by the pool are essential. The busiest pool times are after breakfast and evening as people await the sunset. Quieter midday and early afternoon.
Great observation deck and views of the F1 track.
There are plenty of places to eat - mostly owned by celebrity chefs but in the mall below the hotel is a hawker centre with street food of all descriptions. Very cheap, clean and excellent food. There are boats, ice rink, restaurants, designer shops, gift shops galore
Great shopping and access to the metro station

title: Amazing
text: This futuristic garden is unique. You can walk around the gardens on more than one level. The gardens look different in the day and night. Take drinks as it can get very warm

title: Classy hotel
text:
This hotel is beautiful and offers class and sophistication. We only visited fir the iconic Singapore sling but would love to stay here.
The long bar was under refurbishment but the billiard bar was equally beautiful.
Singapore sling was lovely and the famous peanuts were on the tables. The shells are still thrown on the floor for the birds

title: Unique experience
text:
As residents in the hotel we had unlimited access to the sky park. Visitors can only access the observation deck.
The sky park has restaurants a bar and fantastic views of the city and business sector.
F1 track is below the hotel and the pool is amazing. There are plenty of beds. Access to towels. Lifeguards on duty.
The pool has an adult only section and is busier in the mornings and evenings. The atmosphere changes throughout the day

title: Nothing exciting
text:
This is just the pedestrian side of the bay but plenty to see and do. Boat rides circle the bay. Restaurants line the front. Lots of tourists and it's hot ! There are bars and ice cream shops
Pretty place but nothing special

title: Quaint & creaky
text:
This b&b is up about 12 steps from pavement level. It is 'on the rocks' in a fab position for the sights of Sydney. It's very steep and hilly but walking distance to bridge and opera house
Ideally placed for all forms of transport.
The b&b is family run, very friendly and lovely breakfast. Be warned that not all rooms have en suite. The two rooms on the first floor share a bathroom and toilet.
There is a second floor and no lifts so not ideal for everyone
Everything creaks but is a great place to stay with character. Makes a change from the 'corporate hotel'

title: Amazing
text:
So glad we paid for front facing sea view. Our room was on 11th floor
You could people watch all day. Surfers were out from sunrise to sunset. Ideally placed for beach. Zoo. Transport. Restaurants. Trolleys.
Hotel was clean. Friendly staff lovely pool
Can't fault it

title: Informative day out
text:
We took the purple loop trolley but could have done with getting there earlier
We managed tickets to go to Arizona memorial which was great
Lots of information. Shop for souvenirs. You can't take any size bag in but lockers are provided

title: Respectful and informative
text:
Whilst maintaining respect to the bodies that were buried with the ship the memorial is informative and interesting
Ample time to see the detail and pay respect to the men who list their lives.

title: Just as we imagined
text:
An iconic beach. Full of buzzing activity. Surfers from dawn to dusk and beyond. Lovely sand. beach patrols display safety flags
Lots of places to eat. Don't expect secluded beaches.
Loved it

title: Beautiful ship
text:
Standing proud in the Harbour this is part of the scenery in the visit to Pearl Harbour.
It wasn't open for visiting on the day we were there due to some maintenance.

title: Death by Burger
text:
OMG what an amazing burger. Not what we initially expected. It was not a restaurant just a takeaway but you could eat on premises.
Choice of style of burger
1,2 or 3 x 1/3lb burgers on your stack. Cooked to your liking. Choices of chips - cheese & bacon. Garlic butter chips etc etc etc
Milk shakes to die for !
Don't expect to move around much if you clean your plate !

title: Beautiful
text:
We booked to see the Polynesian Luau arriving later afternoon. We would have loved to have spent the day there as it was so unexpectedly beautiful with far more to do than we had thought.
We enjoyed the food and dancing at the Luau with flower lei's provided and also the evening show

title: Excellent show
text:
Excellent show. well though out. Well choreographed show at the end of a lovely day. The actors have all worked in the park during the day. Demonstrates the circle of human life
Thoroughly enjoyed it
A shame photography is not allowed

title: Great city great location
text:
This was our first stop on our round the world trip. The room was clean bed extremely comfortable and the location was excellent for sight seeing - just a few hundred yards from the Whitehorse. Restaurant attached to hotel served great breakfasts
Cold filtered water and plastic bottles available on the corridor.
place: Club Quarters Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: Great monument
text:
Very busy area. Tour busses and hop on / off busses all stop here.
Access is good plenty of opportunity for photographs

title: Excellent food
text:
Celebrating a birthday we had booked a table for 12 people. A £10 deposit each had been requested.
The menu was good. Food excellent. Service attentive
They do a lunch time set price menu and there are tables all around the upstairs balcony
The bar is downstairs tables are all upstairs with no disabled access - as we had an elderly lady with an artificial leg in our family she was unable to come as she could not have climbed the stairs.

title: Airport hotel
text:
We stopped over for one night to cut a long flight time. The hotel do a courtesy bus from airport but it took us ages to get collected. We discovered it served more than one hotel. The driver relies on tips to substitute his wages.
The hotel has a pool which was useful as we used it whilst waiting for check in time
Rooms clean but old AC system so quite noisy.
Hard 8 barbeque a short taxi ride away was well worth trying
place: Best Western Plus Dallas Hotel & Conference Center

title: Excellent experience
text:
In 100 + degrees we visited the smoke pit. What an amazing experience. Free water while you queue
The pit master explained the process - you buy meat by the lb (cooked)
The rib eye steak was to die for
Far too much food but boxes for do it yourself doggy bags are readily available to help yourself. Unlimited soft drinks can't fault it

title: Top class food
text:
We have been here many times. Despite trying others we always come back here. The place is small so advanced booking essential at busy times. The service is good. Food is excellent
Can't fault it at all

title: Amazing ice cream
text: Very popular place. We have visited on a few occasions. The choices of ice creams and sorbets are amazing. Everyone has a different favourite. Patient and helpful staff Well worth a visit
place: Our Cow Molly Dairy Farm & Ice Cream Shop

title: Nice food
text:
Family meal. Excellent children's choice. Varied menu.
Fab food served nice & hot. Very busy so long wait but worth it.
Reasonably priced. Thoroughly enjoyed it

title: Conference day
text:
I recently attended a conference day and found the hotel easy to find. Ample parking. Helpful staff and the facilities were super
The food was served on time and was delicious.
Soft Drinks prices a bit steep but more or less what you would expect for this type of venue.
I will go back and try the restaurant another time as the menu looked lovely
place: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Sheffield Park

title: Meat heaven
text:
Decisions decisions. What a meat filled menu. Offers fab sounding dishes that make you want to try them all. We were ready to moan that the nibbles we ordered didn't arrive at the same time but when they came they were with complementary extras to apologise. So complaint diffused. Well done waiter
We over ordered but the food was tasty all be it a bit dry
No real complaints. Desserts were as described and cocktails were gorgeous. Pleasantly surprised at total bill amount.
Great atmosphere. Waiter helpful and efficient. He also advised on best cocktails.
All in all an enjoyable evening

title: Excellent as usual
text:
We eat here regularly but ate with our daughters Indian friend who thought the food was good. Confirmation that the food is excellent.
Service good (although very grumpy person took table reservation request over telephone in the afternoon)
Always our favourite

title: Great menu choices
text:
While visiting nearby Westwood lakes we ventured here for a change at tea time.
The menu is vast and different. The prices although 2 for 1 are just slightly higher than what we expected but food was hot & tasty.
The lamb steak only came with chips so looked lacking. Maybe a few peas or corn on the cob would have been nice.
We returned again the second night to try alternative dishes

title: Enjoyable stay
text:
As a group of friends who have a 'girlie weekend' every year we booked the windmill for this years adventure. We stayed in 1 cornflower cottage which was furnished really nicely. A twin room with en-suite shower room / toilet
A double 4 poster attached to a single room with en-suite shower room / toilet
It was clean and well equipped but we chose not to cater. We booked full breakfast for both mornings and this was lovely with cereals juice tea coffee and toast in abundance
A pleasant stay - very nice

title: Beautiful resort
text:
We had brilliant rooms in the garden wing. Block 101 - 110 was ideal. The rooms are luxurious with everything you need
The staff were knowledgeable helpful and friendly
The grounds were well kept and all the areas of the hotel were clean and cared for
The pool is divided into sections with a quieter area 2.2m deep where non swimmers are not allowed.
The restaurants serve beautiful food - I will review them individually - but are quite expensive and as there is very little around the hotel there is nowhere cheaper to go.
We paid around £40 per person each night
Which is quite expensive in Malaysia in comparison to other restaurants and we were told food at the sister hotel is cheaper
The grounds were lovely with plenty of beds and there was a nice touch in the afternoon with cold flannels followed by complimentary fruit and an ice cream
There was a 'happy hour' I the bar 5-6pm and 7-8pm but limited drinks available and the happy hour price was not really cheap
Fresh towels were available every day and plenty of cold water to help yourself to drinks
Lovely coffee shop with gorgeous cakes which are reduced to half price after 6pm.
Very helpful staff

title: Beautiful food
text:
The staff were helpful and attentive
The starters were large and very filling. Main courses were delicious but we probably could have shared a few main courses and still had too much.
A little bit pricey but the food was excellent
place: Naan - Flavours of India at Shangri-La's Rasa Ria Resort

title: Excellent food - poor atmosphere
text:
This restaurant is away from the main area of the hotel and sits in the 'ocean view' wing which is a little more exclusive.
We booked but the restaurant was almost empty. That said the food was beautiful. The minestrone soup is served in an unusual way - I won't spoil it for you
The starters and main courses, although the menu seems limited, are all absolutely delicious. If you go for all courses and drinks it is not cheap.
We ate there twice but just had starter and main course the 2nd visit. Then went to the hotel coffee shop for delicious coffee and half price cakes !

title: Great Experience
text:
We booked this restaurant to celebrate my husbands birthday. There was a slight misunderstanding when booking but John the manager was very helpful and we ended up with Chef Hamizal all to ourselves.
It was our first experience of Teppanyaki and Hamizal explained everything and demonstrated some fantastic cooking. We ordered fish and meat set menus but as there were 6 of us we were able to try everything. His trick with the eggs at the end was fab
We will definitely try Teppanyaki again
Thank you John for making the birthday celebrations special

title: Great range of food
text:
We ate here both late afternoon from the pool and evening buffet
The food is excellent. The buffet is great because you can choose your ingredients and the chef in individual sections will cook it for you
No reason to go hungry there is food for everyone

title: Fab Hotel
text:
This hotel is well placed to access the city. Lovely hotel great food, great pool, helpful staff
Rooms huge, complimentary water which went down a treat. Great shopping mall inside if you need it. Fun fair with roller coaster inside too !
We used the Monorain and trains - the monorail station is directly outside the hotel
We had drinks in the bar 1st night - average uk drinks prices but there was a private party the 2nd night so we sat In the breakfast dining area and Zol came to our rescue !! He was lovely. Brought us drinks and nibbles
Can't fault this hotel
place: Berjaya Times Square Hotel, Kuala Lumpur

title: Quirky
text:
Hotel with a difference. Looked good fun but was very quiet when we was there. Prices average
Places to eat around the rides not very clearly signposted where to pay / ride etc

title: A dining experience
text:
Like dining in your local market place food was very cheap but not always sure what you would get when you order
Lovely noodle dishes great smells - English food for those who want it
Beer uk prices
Great opportunity to experience local cuisine

title: Authentic local foid
text:
Extremely busy restaurant
Comprehensive menu ! We ordered loads of different dishes including frog !!
Atmosphere was buzzing food was excellent, hot and fresh. Staff were efficient helpful and friendly.
Great place to eat

title: Fab city
text: We did a guided bus tour which took us to many sights and told us the history of the buildings and people. We were dropped off in the town close to China town area where we sampled the street food and excellent shopping. We also used the public transport Monorail and train to other attractions

title: Ticked the box
text:
Ideally placed, access to lake front, shops, bars restaurants, breakfast on the expensive side but clean, good food,
Ideal for a sightseeing city break
Rooms are compact but beds very comfortable. Bathroom is a 'pod' but adequate. Extractor fan didn't work but in my experience they never do !

title: Lovely food
text:
We ate here 3 nights in a row while staying in the Ibis Paradiso just across the road. Limited menu but excellent food, burgers were delicious some served with potato Rosti Some with cheese and / or eggs. Mixed salads were great. Service was friendly.
Out door eating at its best. Ice cream dessert prices extortionate !! Main meals average prices for the area.
French fries were delicious and you got a huge plateful !
They have a cakes / pastries/ coffee shop but we only ate evening meal. Alcohol was served and beer was cold

title: Beautiful resort
text:
We visited for a weekend and the lake is beautiful. There are lots of beautiful bars, restaurants, coffee shops, speaks lots of Italian
Plenty to do on and around the lake with fountains shooting high in the air.
Lovely place with variety of priced accommodation around and about
Hire a boat, sunbed, relax, be busy, plenty to see and do

title: A truely hidden gem
text: We found this gem after a search for child friendly restaurants in Sheffield. 8 of us looking for a venue for my daughters 30th birthday. We found it straight away because the other helpful reviews warned us what to look for. We were not disappointed the service was with a smile, the food was outstanding. The students were amazing. Cannot fault it in any way in fact I took a friend back today and they recognised us from the week before. Again the food was amazing. We will be visiting many times more for sure

title: Mediocre
text: We booked a table for 18 people for my daughters 30th birthday.The nachos on the table were a nice touch. Waiter was very friendly and quite efficient. Food was fine but not outstanding, Average service time but we heard other waiters apologising for big delays. Sombreros were fun and kids enjoyed them wile we waited for food. Might go again but other places to try first

title: Beautiful
text:
A group booking for 12 people we were seated to time the restaurant is decorated beautifully. Comprehensive menu, friendly staff but £1.40 for a lime & soda ????
Food was lovely maybe a bit of gentle background music would ha been nice as the talking got quite overpowering at times as it was very busy.
Outside sitting area for drinks and downstairs bar / meeting area was lovely
Food average prices for Italian restaurant

title: Always good
text: Excellent good. Reasonable prices. friendly staff. Efficient service. Comprehensive menu. Delivery service. What more can you ask for

title: Excellent food
text:
As a lover of Tapas we tried for the first time on a recommendation. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had olives and the beautiful cured Jamon for nibbles.
We were so enthusiastic we forgot to take photos !
The selections of tapas were pretty good and the food kept coming as we were eating. All well cooked and nicely presented we all had our favourites.
The Sangria was lovely but the gins were amazing just as they should be - large glass lots of ice
The Churros were gorgeous. We were not rushed and the atmosphere was great

Will definitely return

title: Popular place
text:
I took my grandson to a party after school so the place was heaving. There were 3 parties so hundreds of kids.
The parties were well organised and seemed to flow.
We ordered food and despite how busy it came fairly quickly.
Attempts were made by staff to keep older children out of the younger areas but they have added a ball area where they are sucked up the tubes then drop when the hopper is full - you have to go through the 3yr old area to get to it and it attracts older kids.

All in all as good as could be expected for the busy ness of the place

title: Perfect
text:
Christina and Spiros are good family people. They work hard and keep the studios lovely and clean. Rooms are typical Greek but well stocked. Good fridge. TV. Air Conditioning. We were by the pool and had a lemon tree outside our balcony. Breakfasts are simple with a small variation on eggs / meat but plenty to eat and a beautiful dining area. Or you can take your tray round the pool.
Lovely bar area with big TV
Supermarket next door but one. Bakery across the road. Fantastic restaurant next to Bakery (Costas)
If you eat at Costas you will walk back past 2 ginger cats. The sit in and around the rubbish bins. They love a bit of left over meat
We were made very welcome, Christina speaks the best English. Spiros will make himself understood.
We never revisit the same place twice but are seriously considering returning.

title: Average for Greece
text:
The setting for this restaurant is lovely looking out onto the water. The food is relatively good however we were spoiled by an excellent restaurant across from our accommodation which more than made up for the view.
We did feel rushed and got the impression they wanted to get more people through - I have to say unusual for Greek people

title: Nice food
text:
It was a halfway place too meet with friends from North Yorkshire. Coffee first was unremarkable. Lunch menu had some different choices. Prices were reasonably average for this type of place. Service was friendly and efficient
The pulled lamb in pitta was delicious. We didn't have room for dessert but the afternoon teas looked very nice
